15511.content:
Being undead was a lot of hard work, as Squigly and Leviathan could attest to. Aside from having to constantly fight off the influence of the skull heart, Squigly also had an insatiable appetite, one of the downsides of being undead. She wasn't exactly sure how zombies could be hungry, but she constantly felt the urge to eat, which was even worse for her as she had already been a rather big eater when she was alive, now it was like she was a black hole. The ever adorable Zombie girl wrapped her arms around her stomach as it growled loudly, moaning a bit as the hunger pangs began, which made Leviathan worried about his host. "You know madam, if you're really that hungry, there's nothing wrong with getting a bite to eat. Perhaps we could grab a cheese burger or two to settle your stomach?" Squigly looked to her friend and then back at her stomach. She did have a little money left over from when she was alive, so maybe she could buy a burger or two. "I suppose you're right Leviathan, one burger won't do any harm."

A little later, Squigly had walked into a restaurant, wearing some makeup and a scarf to hide the fact that she was a zombie from people since she didn't want to attract unwanted attention, and was soon next in line to order food. She...

Squigly grunted as she wiggled her dress down. Recently, after a few months of lazing around in the grave site, Squigly had packed on a few pounds to her derriere, which had lifted her usual dress up. Squigly grunted louder, she wouldn't be making an obvious scene if anyone but Leviathan was near. Leviathan attempts to help Squigly push it down, until the two hear the worst thing they could imagine. A loud, annoying rip. Squigly blushed, looking at her backside and sighing.

"Oh Leviathan," She started, "How am I going to be seen like THIS? My rump is out for the whole world to see!"

"It's alright," Leviathan coddled, coddling his host, "You'll be fine. We just need a taylor."

15521.content: It was a busy day at the River King Casino, and the lovely Dagonian girl known to many if not all as Minette was busy tending to the many customers who came to her dad's Casino for the gambling and fine eating. Minette's dad was none other than the River King himself, which of course made Minette one of the many River Princesses, which wasn't as big a deal as it sounded because Minette's family was absurdly large. Minette's dad usually spoiled his children rotten, using his vast wealth to give them whatever they asked, but Minette never asked her dad for any money, wanting to earn money rather than just have it handed to her. Sure it was hard work since she had two jobs, but she still enjoyed it, after all, she got to see her friend Ms. Fortune almost every day. Today in particular stood out however, as little did Minette know, she wouldn't be so little anymore. She walked to a table to see...

155212.content:
She walked to a table to see a cake, a big, delicious looking cake, lined with pink icing and topped with ice cream. Minette smiled a little at the fact that someone left a cake there, but before she could lift it up to give the thing to someone else, she noticed a little card.

'For Minette'

Minette blushed. Who would bake such a BIG cake for her? Nonetheless, Minette started eating. She only planned on one slice, but, one slice just wasn't enough. The cake was booming with flavor! Minette couldn't help but to have another slice, or another slice, or a whole layer. Minette felt so guilty that she was eating so much, but she kept devouring the cake. Filling her belly with a cake that good felt so great! Afterwards, Minette relaxes in her chair, moaning as she rubbed her belly.
